## R Markdown

Lahmen Hall of Fame Table
```{r}
library(Lahman)
head(HallOfFame, 3)
```

Hall of Fame Graph
```{r}
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)

HallOfFame %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = yearID, fill = inducted)) +
  geom_bar() +
  xlim(c(1936, 2022))
```

CSV
```{r}

write.csv(HallOfFame, "HallOfFame.csv", row.names = FALSE)

```


Scrape Baseball Reference
```{r}

library(rvest)
url <- "https://www.baseball-reference.com/awards/hof_2024.shtml"
html <- read_html(url)
tables <- html_table(html)

View(tables[[1]])
```


Variable Names in Line 1
```{r}

data <- tables[[1]]
actual_col_names <- data[1, ]
colnames(data) <- actual_col_names
data <- data[-1, ]
head(data, 3)

```



Check Variable Types
```{r}

data$Votes <- as.numeric(data$Votes)

```


Functions needed
```{r}

data <- data %>% select(-c(6:39))

data <- data %>%
  mutate(YoB = str_remove_all(YoB, "(st|nd|rd|th)$"))
data <- data %>%
  mutate(`%vote` = str_remove_all(`%vote`, "(%)$"))

data <- data %>%
  mutate(Name = gsub("^X-", "", Name))

data <- data %>% mutate(
  yearID = 2024,
  inducted = ifelse(Votes>=289, "Y", "N"),
) %>% rename(
  votes = Votes)
  
View(tables[[1]])
```
